title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that this age group might be composed of temporary residents (e.g., students or inmates).

Two points for explaining a reason why the largest proportion of the population is in the age-15-to-29 age group.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following reasons why the largest proportion of the population is in the age-15-to-29 age group:
The response correctly explains one of the following reasons why the largest proportion of the population is in the age-15-to-29 age group:
The response correctly explains one of the following reasons why the largest proportion of the population is in the age-15-to-29 age group:

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating a political pull factor.

Two points for describing how a political pull factor might motivate a female migrant from a rural area to move to an urban area in a very distant location.
descriptions: The response does not correctly describe one of the following :

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that the 0-15 population is growing.

Two points for explaining why the 0-15 population is growing.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following types of population change indicated by the population pyramid for age 0 to 15:
The response correctly explains one of the following types of population change indicated by the population pyramid for age 0 to 15:

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that the population pyramid does not provide direct information about long-term population growth.

Two points for explaining how an additional type of data would be required to illustrate long-term population growth.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following limitations of the population pyramid shown in illustrating the long-term population growth of the location:
The response correctly explains one of the following limitations of the population pyramid shown in illustrating the long-term population growth of the location:
